text: A lot of us grow up and we grow out of the literal interpretation that we get when we're children, but we bear the scars all our life. Whether they're scars of beauty or scars of ugliness, it's pretty much in the eye of the beholder.
author: Stephen King

text: If truth is beauty, how come no one has their hair done in the library?
author: Lily Tomlin

text: Everyone has their own insecurities, regardless of how you look or how people perceive you, but sometimes people give their insecurities too much power. Defining beauty is simply a matter of opinion. For me, real beauty has very little to do with the structure of someone's face or body.
author: Devon Aoki

text: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

text: It was one of those evenings when men feel that truth, goodness and beauty are one. In the morning, when they commit their discovery to paper, when others read it written there, it looks wholly ridiculous.
author: Aldous Huxley
